structure.unit: PHYSICIANS, OSTEOPATHS, PODIATRISTS, AND RELATED MEDICAL PRACTITIONERS

law.catch_line: Status of laetrile -- May be prescribed, when.
law.text: Amygdalin (laetrile) is not a drug or a controlled substance under Kentucky statutes governing the use, manufacture, or distribution of drugs and controlled substances within the state. A physician may prescribe amygdalin (laetrile) pursuant to KRS 311.956 if the patient so requests on a written informed request form and the physician has determined the patient to be terminally ill.
law.history: Created 1980 Ky. Acts ch. 354, sec. 1, effective July 15, 1980.
